we.0: Privacy and How We Use Your Information

we.1: Privacy and How We Use Your Information

we.2: Privacy and How We Use Your Information

we.3: We are committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. This policy sets out the basis on which any information from which you can be identified (referred to as "Personal Data")  that we collect from you, or that you provide to us, will be processed by us. Please read the following carefully to understand our processes and practices regarding your Personal Data and how we will treat it.

we.4: For the purpose of the Data Protection Legislation, we, Hobbycraft Trading Ltd, Registered office: 0806269 of 7 Enterprise Way, Christchurch, Dorset Bh23 6HG, are the Data Controller.

we.5: Personal data we may collect from you

we.6: We may collect and process the following Personal Data about you:

we.7: to provide you with information about other goods and services we offer that are similar to those that you have already purchased or enquired about

we.8: The Personal Data you give us may include items such as your name, address, e-mail address and phone number. We rely on ‘contractual necessity’ as the lawful ground for the processing of your Personal Data in such cases.

we.9: 2. Personal Data that we collect about you

we.10: This includes automatically collecting and using the following Personal Data: technical information, including your account registered information, payment account reference (PAR) relating to your debit or credit card, and information about your session, including the information (such as scrolling, clicks), and other Personal Data supplied as part of the registration to the Hobbycraft Club and using the Website or app to purchase products. The legal basis on which we process this Personal Data is primarily for the purpose of pursuing our legitimate interests as an arts and crafts retailer.

we.11: Personal Data we collect from your user generated content to use for marketing, advertising and promotional purposes

we.12: We use Personal Data held about you in the following ways:

we.13: to provide you with information about other goods and services we offer that are similar to those that you have already purchased or enquired about;

we.15: Personal Data we collect from user generated content. We will use this Personal Data for marketing, advertising and promotional purposes in accordance with our Terms and Conditions (using the services of Bazaarvoice, Inc. to do so).

we.16: We supply incident details and CCTV images of people responsible for unlawful acts within our premises to Facewatch; and receive alerts from Facewatch if a person entering our premises is known by Facewatch to be responsible for committing an unlawful act in our premises or elsewhere.

we.17: We display clear signage in all stores where Facewatch is used. This signage details how to obtain the Facewatch privacy notice.

we.18: We may share your Personal Data with any member of the group of companies of which we are a part.

we.19: We may disclose your Personal Data to third parties:

we.20: in the event that we sell or buy any business or assets, in which case we may disclose your Personal Data to the prospective seller or buyer of such business or assets;

we.21: in the event you agree to our Terms and Conditions in relation to user generated content, in which case we may disclose your Personal Data on public-facing websites, applications and communications for the purposes of marketing, advertising and promotion (and please note that the collection and processing of this Personal Data is carried out on our behalf by Bazaarvoice, Inc.); or

we.22: if we are under a duty to disclose or share your Personal Data in order to comply with any legal obligation; in order to enforce or apply our relevant terms of use relating to each Product and other agreements; or to protect the rights, property, or safety of Hobbycraft Trading LTD, our users, or others. This includes exchanging Personal Data with other companies and organisations for the purposes of fraud protection and credit risk reduction.

we.23: We share data with platforms such as Google, Meta and TikTok to tailor the marketing we send you via their sites and products.

we.24: Where we store and transfer your Personal Data

we.25: The Personal Data that we collect from you, or that you provide to us, will generally be processed by us at a destination anywhere within the UK or European Economic Area (EEA). Transfers between the EU and UK are made on the basis of an adequacy decision by the European Commission. In processing your Personal Data, it will sometimes by necessary for us to transfer your Personal Data outside the UK and EEA, such as where your information is processed by overseas third party service providers located outside the UK and EEA. We will take all steps reasonably necessary to ensure that your Personal Data is treated securely and in any event in accordance with this policy and Data Protection Legislation when it is processed in a location outside the EEA or UK. We may enter into contracts with entities based outside the EEA and UK where this is required by Data Protection Legislation.

we.26: We will retain your Personal Data for as long as your account is active or as needed to provide you with access to our Website or app and services. In relation to Personal Data that we collect from user generated content, we will retain the data for as long as needed for our marketing, promotional and advertising purposes. If you wish to cancel your account or otherwise request that we no longer use your Personal Data, contact us at; privacy@hobbycraft.co.uk we will only retain and use your Personal Data thereafter as necessary to comply with our legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce our agreements.

we.27: The security of your Personal Data is important to us. We comply with accepted industry standards to protect the Personal Data submitted to us. We use strict procedures and advanced security features to try to prevent unauthorised access. No method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage, is however 100% secure. Therefore, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

we.28: Where we have given you (or where you have chosen) a password which enables you to access certain parts of our Website or app, you are responsible for keeping this password confidential. You are not permitted to share a password with anyone.

we.29: Our Website or app may, from time to time, contain links to and from the websites of our partners, advertisers and affiliates. If you follow a link to any of these websites, please note that these websites have their own privacy policies and that we do not accept any responsibility or liability for these policies. We encourage you to carefully read the privacy notice of any website you visit.

we.30: You can exercise any of your rights outlined above by contacting us at privacy@hobbycraft.co.uk and we will action your request within one month. Where we receive a large number of requests, or receive especially complex requests, this may be extended by a maximum of two further months. If we fail to meet these deadlines or if you feel your rights have not been adequately respected, you may complain to the Supervisory Authority and/or seek a judicial remedy.

we.31: Any changes we may make to our privacy policy in the future will be posted on our website and, where appropriate, notified to you by e-mail.

policy.3: We are committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. This policy sets out the basis on which any information from which you can be identified (referred to as "Personal Data")  that we collect from you, or that you provide to us, will be processed by us. Please read the following carefully to understand our processes and practices regarding your Personal Data and how we will treat it.

policy.4: The Personal Data that we collect from you, or that you provide to us, will generally be processed by us at a destination anywhere within the UK or European Economic Area (EEA). Transfers between the EU and UK are made on the basis of an adequacy decision by the European Commission. In processing your Personal Data, it will sometimes by necessary for us to transfer your Personal Data outside the UK and EEA, such as where your information is processed by overseas third party service providers located outside the UK and EEA. We will take all steps reasonably necessary to ensure that your Personal Data is treated securely and in any event in accordance with this policy and Data Protection Legislation when it is processed in a location outside the EEA or UK. We may enter into contracts with entities based outside the EEA and UK where this is required by Data Protection Legislation.

policy.5: Any changes we may make to our privacy policy in the future will be posted on our website and, where appropriate, notified to you by e-mail.

policy.6: Questions, comments and requests regarding this privacy policy are welcomed and should be addressed to privacy@hobbycraft.co.uk
